str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To carry, bear away (sometimes with violence). From apo and phero; to bear off.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Wind, breath, spirit.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Lonesome, i.e. waste.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Crimson, scarlet, dyed with Kermes (coccum), the female coccus of the Kermes oak. From kokkos; crimson-colored.
Properly: a wild beast, hence: any animal; met: a brute. Diminutive from the same as thera; a dangerous animal.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: To be full of. A primary verb; to swell out, i.e. Be full.
Abusive or scurrilous language, blasphemy. From blasphemos; vilification.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Seven. A primary number; seven.
From the primary kapto; the head, literally or figuratively.
And, even, also, namely.
Ten. A primary number; ten.
From a primary kar; a horn.
